6900.name: The Scorched Shore
6900.description:
The sea laps against black volcanic sand, hissing where waves meet
geothermally heated rock. Steam rises from vents scattered across the
beach, and the air reeks of sulfur. To the north, the waters lead back
to the Sunken Coast. Inland, a hellish landscape of ash and magma awaits.

west.description: The sea route leads back to the reef.

east.description: A path leads inland through the ash.

6901.name: Ash-Covered Trail
6901.description:
A trail cuts through knee-deep drifts of grey volcanic ash. Every step
sends up choking clouds of fine particles. The skeletal remains of trees
jut from the ash like blackened bones. Somewhere ahead, an orange glow
pulses against the perpetually overcast sky.

west.description: The trail leads back to the scorched shore.

east.description: The trail continues through the ashfields.

6902.name: The Ashfields
6902.description:
A vast expanse of grey ash stretches in every direction, broken only by
jutting spires of black obsidian and the occasional steam vent belching
sulfurous gas. The ground is uncomfortably warm underfoot, and cracks
in the earth glow with the dull red of magma far below. Nothing grows
here. Nothing should live here.

west.description: The trail leads back toward the coast.

north.description: A path winds between obsidian spires.

east.description: The ash grows deeper toward the volcanic heart.

6903.name: Obsidian Spire Field
6903.description:
Towering spires of black volcanic glass erupt from the ashen ground,
some reaching thirty feet into the smoky sky. They catch what little
light exists and throw it back in razor-sharp reflections. The spaces
between the spires create a natural maze, and something moves in the
shadows between them.

north.description: A gap between spires leads further north.

east.description: A narrow path winds through the spires.

6904.name: The Cinder Wastes
6904.description:
The ground crunches with every step — not ash here, but solidified
cinders and pumice, sharp enough to cut through thin boots. Rivers of
cooled lava snake across the landscape in frozen black streams. In the
distance, a massive structure belches smoke and steam — the Clockwork
Foundry, built into the side of a dormant volcano.

south.description: The obsidian spires rise to the south.

north.description: The path leads toward the Foundry.

6905.name: Before the Clockwork Foundry
6905.description:
Enormous blast doors of riveted iron are set into the volcanic rock face.
Pipes and vents protrude from the mountainside around them, releasing
regular blasts of steam and smoke. The ground vibrates with the rhythm
of vast machinery working deep within. A signpost — incongruously neat
amid the desolation — stands beside the doors.

north.description: The blast doors lead into the Clockwork Foundry.

extra_descs.signpost sign:
A brass plaque reads:
  CLOCKWORK FOUNDRY
  Authorized Personnel Only
  Trespassers Will Be Processed
  (Management is not responsible for dismemberment)

6906.name: Steam Vent Valley
6906.description:
A depression in the ashlands is filled with hissing steam vents that
erupt at irregular intervals, sending boiling columns of vapor twenty
feet into the air. The ground between vents is crusted with yellow
sulfur deposits and mineral stains of vivid orange and green. The heat
is nearly unbearable.

north.description: A treacherous path leads north through the steam.

6907.name: The Magma Flows
6907.description:
Here the earth's fury is laid bare. Rivers of molten rock flow sluggishly
through channels carved over millennia, casting everything in hellish
orange light. The heat distorts the air into shimmering waves, and the
roar of flowing magma drowns out all but the loudest sounds. Narrow
bridges of cooled stone span the flows.

south.description: The steam vent valley lies south.

west.description: A path leads west through obsidian spires.

north.description: A stone bridge crosses the widest flow.

6908.name: The Burning Bridge
6908.description:
A narrow bridge of volcanic stone arches over a wide river of magma.
The stone is hot enough to burn bare skin, and the bridge sways
alarmingly under your weight. Chunks of rock occasionally break from
the edges and plunge into the molten river below with brilliant
splashes of orange fire.

south.description: The magma flows lie on the southern bank.

north.description: The bridge reaches the northern bank.

6909.name: The Apocalypse Approach
6909.description:
Beyond the magma flows, the landscape takes on an even more nightmarish
quality. The sky is permanently stained red, and the air crackles with
strange energy. In the distance, the dark towers of a fortress rise —
Castle Apocalypse, seat of unimaginable power. The road here is paved
with blackened skulls, fused together by volcanic heat.

south.description: The burning bridge spans the magma.

extra_descs.skulls road:
Thousands of skulls, fused into a macabre roadway by intense heat.
Some still seem to be screaming.

6910.name: Scorched Wasteland
6910.description:
A desolate expanse where even the ash has been burned away, leaving
bare, cracked rock that radiates heat. The remains of some great battle
litter the ground — twisted metal, shattered weapons, and scorched
bones. Whatever happened here was cataclysmic.

extra_descs.battle remains bones:
The armor fragments bear no recognizable insignia. Whatever army
fought here has been erased from history along with its soldiers.

6911.name: A Sheltered Hollow
6911.description:
A depression in the rock, shielded from the worst of the heat and ash
by overhanging volcanic formations. Someone has built a crude shelter
here from scavenged metal and stone. A fire pit glows with embers that
never seem to die — fueled by volcanic gas seeping from below.

6900.name: fire elemental
6900.long_desc: A swirling column of flame dances here, radiating intense heat.
6900.description:
This elemental is a vortex of living fire, roughly humanoid in shape.
Flames of white, orange, and blue spiral around a blindingly bright
core. The air around it shimmers and distorts.

6901.name: ash wraith
6901.long_desc: A spectral figure of swirling ash and ember hovers here, moaning.
6901.description:
This undead horror is formed from volcanic ash animated by dark magic.
Its form shifts constantly, vaguely humanoid one moment and a shapeless
cloud the next. Embers glow like malevolent eyes within its form.

6902.name: magma crawler
6902.long_desc: A massive insectoid creature of molten rock crawls along the ground.
6902.description:
This nightmarish creature resembles a centipede the size of a horse,
its segmented body composed of cooling and reheating rock. Magma seeps
from the joints between its segments, and its mandibles glow white-hot.

6903.name: volcanic drake
6903.long_desc: A drake of black scales and smoldering wings perches on an obsidian spire.
6903.description:
This lesser dragon is native to the Ashlands, its scales black as obsidian
and veined with glowing orange cracks like cooling lava. Smoke curls from
its nostrils, and its eyes burn with primordial fire.

6904.name: ashland scavenger
6904.long_desc: A desperate-looking scavenger picks through debris, protected by heavy wrappings.
6904.description:
This scavenger is bundled in layers of heat-resistant wrappings and wears
thick goggles against the ash. They make a living collecting obsidian,
sulfur, and salvage from the wastes, and know these lands intimately.

6900.name: obsidian blade
6900.description: A blade knapped from volcanic obsidian, its edge impossibly thin and sharp.
